channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: TeleMessage, a modified Signal clone used by US govt. officials, has been hacked
item.description: A hacker has exploited a vulnerability in TeleMessage, which provides modded versions of encrypted messaging apps such as Signal, Telegram and WhatsAp...

item.title: Apple plans to split iPhone 18 launch into two phases in 2026
item.description: Apple is planning to split the launch of its iPhone 18 range, expected in 2026, by about half a year, The Information reported, citing supply chain so...

item.title: MoneyFellows raises $13M to take its group savings model outside Egypt
item.description: While most African digital lenders depend on working capital to fuel growth, MoneyFellows has quietly done what few others have: lend billions of Egyp...

item.title: Anysphere, which makes Cursor, has reportedly raised $900M at $9B valuation
item.description: Anysphere, the maker of AI-powered coding tool Cursor, has attracted $900 million in a fresh round of funding led by Thrive Capital, The Financial Tim...

item.title: Scientists Have Just Discovered a New Type of Electricity-Conducting Bacteria
item.description: A new species of cable bacteria, which function like electrical wiring, was recently discovered in the US. Its unique morphology and genetic structure...

item.title: The Dream of the Metaverse Is Dying. Manufacturing Is Keeping It Alive
item.description: Forget Mark Zuckerberg’s vision of VR meetings; the industrial metaverse bridges digital and physical worlds in a way that’s actually useful.

item.title: Rejoice! Carmakers Are Embracing Physical Buttons Again
item.description: Amazingly, reaction times using screens while driving are worse than being drunk or high—no wonder 90 percent of drivers hate using touchscreens in ca...

item.title: Security Researchers Warn a Widely Used Open Source Tool Poses a 'Persistent' Risk to the US
item.description: The open source software easyjson is used by the US government and American companies. But its ties to Russia’s VK, whose CEO has been sanctioned, hav...

item.title: Formula 1 Drivers Just Hit the Track in These Full-Sized Lego Cars
item.description: At the Miami Grand Prix's driver's parade, the sport's biggest stars rode in drivable Lego cars that took eight months to build. It was as awesome as ...

item.title: Is Duolingo the face of an AI jobs crisis?
item.description: Duolingo announced plans this week to replace contractors with AI and become an “AI-first” company — a move that journalist Brian Merchant pointed to ...
